orbitTopics.title: Low Earth Orbit (LEO)
orbitTopics.description: Altitude 160–2000 km. Hosts Cartosat, RISAT, EOS, enabling high-resolution revisits for land mapping.

orbitTopics.title: Medium Earth Orbit (MEO)
orbitTopics.description: Altitude 2,000–35,000 km. NavIC constellation flies in inclined geosynchronous slots for regional coverage.

orbitTopics.title: Geostationary Orbit (GEO)
orbitTopics.description: 36,000 km equatorial orbit matching Earth rotation. INSAT/GSAT deliver uninterrupted telecom and weather feeds.

orbitTopics.title: Sun Synchronous Orbit (SSO)
orbitTopics.description: Polar orbit with consistent local time passes. Ideal for Earth observation constellations requiring uniform lighting.

tleInsights.title: Two-Line Elements (TLE)
tleInsights.text: Compact NASA/NORAD format describing orbital planes, mean motion, eccentricity, and inclination.

tleInsights.title: SGP4 propagation
tleInsights.text: Mathematical model that advances TLEs forward in time. Our backend uses tle.js to predict footprints.

tleInsights.title: Project link
tleInsights.text: Prediction API ingests TLE per satellite, runs SGP4 for pass forecasts, and streams coordinates to the map.
